How We Help

Disaster relief, public policy advocacy, and partnerships

PRIMARY CTA
{"title"=>"Our Role in Fighting Hunger in Texas", "text"=>"TFBN plays a statewide, coordinating role in areas too large for any one food bank. These include disaster relief, public policy advocacy, and partnerships with statewide entities.\n\nWe also help the network of 20 regional food banks to build the capacity to end hunger by managing statewide food sourcing and purchasing programs, offering expert technical assistance and training, and spreading food bank innovations and best practices statewide.\n"}
300 million lbs Of food distributed to over 3 million Texans in 2011
▼

How do low-income texans get help feeding their children?


SECONDARY CTA

Leading the Movement

Food insecurity is the most broadly-used measure of food deprivation in the United States. The USDA defines food insecurity as meaning “consistent access to adequate food is limited by a lack of money and other resources at times during the year.”

Our Programs

Food insecurity is the most broadly-used measure of food deprivation in the United States. The USDA defines food insecurity as meaning “consistent access to adequate food is limited by a lack of money and other resources at times during the year.”

Strengthening Our Response

Food insecurity is the most broadly-used measure of food deprivation in the United States. The USDA defines food insecurity as meaning “consistent access to adequate food is limited by a lack of money and other resources at times during the year.”

1.9 million children Lived in food insecure homes in 2012
